description: Reference documentation for contact model properties. Each contact model has specific properties that control its mechanical behavior. Use this reference when setting properties via 'contact cmat', 'contact property', or Python SDK.

property_metadata_fields.description: Description including physical meaning and units
property_metadata_fields.modifiable: Can be changed after contact creation

models.name: linear
models.description: Linear elastic-frictional contact model with optional damping

models.name: linearcbond
models.description: Linear model with contact-based bonds for point adhesion

models.name: linearpbond
models.description: Linear model with parallel bonds for cemented materials - transmits force AND moment
models.common_use: Cemented particulate materials, intact rock, bonded assemblies

models.name: hertz
models.description: Nonlinear elastic contact model based on Hertz-Mindlin theory - F_n ~ Î´^1.5
models.common_use: Impact simulations, nonlinear elasticity, realistic contact mechanics

models.name: rrlinear
models.description: Linear model with torque mechanism opposing rolling motion - simulates surface roughness effects
models.common_use: Granular materials with rolling resistance, heap repose angle analysis

notes: Property availability depends on the contact model
Inheritable properties can receive values from contacting pieces
Non-modifiable properties are read-only or calculated automatically
Use 'emod' and 'kratio' with deformability method for automatic stiffness calculation
Vector properties use contact plane coordinate system
